patrick love

exploring the web of our world

Who I Be

Writer. Traveler. Sportsman. Dreamer. Mistake-Maker. Lesson-Learner. Bounce-Backer. Hustle+Hacker.

Ever since I made my first website (NHRT*) in high school and witnessed it take the student body by storm, I've been hooked by the power of the web. Upon graduating from the University of Texas at Austin, though, I wanted to try my hand at a few different endeavors and continue to shape my mind and character through extensive travel. I kept dabbling in web development through freelance projects, but I came full circle in 2014 when I decided (from a cramped hostel bunk bed in Lima, Peru) it was time to take my web skills to the next level and enroll in an intensive 12-week "code school" back in the States.

*Please see the "Fun Facts" section below for more info.

I'm still a citizen of the world, but now I'm more empowered to effectively communicate with all my fellow inhabitants on Earth. I believe the depth of my exposure to people from different walks of life and corners of the globe uniquely positions me to tailor web ventures in ways that will ultimately catch on. But the bottom line is simple: the key is to believe in what we're working on and the effect we can have on others. Otherwise it's simply not worth it.

A Glimpse of the Skills

Click to see Who Got Next

Who Got Next

Tap image to see Who Got Next

I'm a baller. But I don't feel like one when I bike all the way up to the local basketball court only to find there's no one else there. It always used to drive me crazy to waste so much time just waiting around, hoping others would show up for a pickup game. Better late than never, I solved this problem by engineering Who Got Next as my final project whilst a Front-End Engineering student at The Iron Yard.

Watch: Who Got Next is unveiled at TIY Demo Day!

Hand-crafted with: Ember | Firebase | Google Maps API | GeoFire | Handlebars

Majestic Thai

Tap image to see Majestic Thai

When my instructor assigned this homework project over a long weekend, I was ecstatic. After all, I lived in Thailand and it always pains me to pay $15 at a Thai joint in America for a dish I used to eat on the street for less than a dollar. So don't be alarmed when you notice all the prices are listed in Thai Baht, as I promise the food is up to par and - Thai fare or not - now I'm ready to help any restaurant accept orders from their website!

Click to see Majestic Thai

Hand-crafted with: Backbone | Firebase | jQuery | Underscore

Click to see Turn-Based Battle Game

Turn-Based Battle Game

Tap image to see Turn-Based Battle Game

This one was fun. My skills have come a long way since I made it and there are some aspects I would code differently if I did it all over again, but back in the day I used to love playing Final Fantasy RPGs, so writing damage algorithms for the first time and then experiencing my dynamic gameplay come to life during testing was definitely rewarding. If you think you're up for the challenge, watch out for Jaws - he's tough!

Hand-crafted with: JavaScript | HTML5 | CSS3

Five Fun Facts

*At the top of the page I mentioned making my first website (NHRT) in high school...Well, have you ever gotten bored with plain old Lemon-Lime or Fruit Punch and opted for a Gatorade X-Factor instead? You can thank NHRT (National Hybrid Research Team) for that. No, we didn't reap the financial rewards of such a stroke of mixology brilliance - the idealists we were in high school couldn't have been less concerned with intellectual property rights and patents - but we got some serious traffic for a while and then all of a sudden Gatorade started producing their own "hybrids". Unfortunately, the site (www.areyoumixing.com) is no longer accessible due to an overhaul of the Tripod free hosting program, but long live the memories and keep on mixing!
